servinfo.title: DTC P2138: Pedal Position Sensor (Main / Sub) Voltage Correlation

entry.ptxt: Ground of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor for shield wire

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Difference between the opening angle based on accelerator pedal position sensor (main) and the opening angle based on accelerator pedal position sensor (sub) is more than specification for specified time continuously.

item.ptxt: Accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor (main) and (sub) circuit

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Keep the accelerator pedal at idle position for 2 seconds.
Keep the accelerator pedal at fully depressed position for 2 seconds.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions for DTC Troubleshooting:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal position sensor and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check each voltage of “APP Sensor 1 Volt” and “APP Sensor 2 Volt” displayed on scan tool when accelerator pedal is idle position and fully depressed.

testgroup.question: Is displayed each APP sensor value as described voltage in Scan Tool Data:M16A and J20A ?

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly at “BLU/YEL”, “BLU/GRN”, “ORN/BLU”, “ORN”, “WHT/BLU” and “WHT” wire terminals.

If OK, measure voltage between “WHT” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and vehicle body ground, between “ORN/BLU” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and vehicle body ground with ignition switch turned ON.
Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “E23-56” and “E23-53” terminals.
If OK, measure resistance between “E23-56” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground, between “E23-53” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

action.ptxt: “WHT” wire or “ORN/BLU” wire is shorted to other circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure voltage between “E23-56” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground, between “E23-53” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
“WHT” wire or “ORN/GRN” wire is shorted to other circuit.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “E23-55”, “E23-54”, “E23-52” and “E23-51” terminals.

If OK, measure resistance between “WHT/BLU” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and vehicle body ground, between “BLU/GRN” wire terminal of accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly connector and vehicle body ground.

action.ptxt: “WHT/BLU” wire or “BLU/GRN” wire is shorted to other circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure voltage between “E23-55” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground, between “E23-52” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

action.ptxt: “WHT/BLU” wire or “BLU/GRN” wire is shorted to other circuit.

testgroup.title: Accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly check

test1.ptxt: 1) Check accelerator pedal position sensor referring to Accelerator Pedal Position (APP) Sensor Assembly Inspection:M16A and J20A .

testgroup.question: Is output voltage within specified value?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
Replace accelerator pedal position (APP) sensor assembly.
